snippet: The number of Americans signing up for unemployment benefits fell unexpectedly last week, the latest sign of recovery in the nation’s labor market.
abstract: Labor Department reports number of Americans signing up for unemployment benefits falls unexpectedly in latest sign of recovery in the nation's labor market; initial claims for state jobless benefits dropped 15,000, to 358,000; four-week average of new filings, which provides a better view of the trend, hit its lowest level since April 2008.
lead_paragraph: The number of Americans signing up for unemployment benefits fell unexpectedly last week, the latest sign of recovery in the nation’s labor market.

headline.main: Claims for Jobless Benefits Fall, Suggesting a Trend
headline.print_headline: Claims for Jobless Benefits Fall, Suggesting a Trend
